title: 1984 Mercedes-Benz 380-Class 380 SL

description: Looking for a true Classic car? This Mercedes 380SL put the "Class" in Classic. It was been meticulously maintained with a pile of documentation to go along with it. We even have the original window sticker showing the car sold for $41,733 in 1982 by todays standards that would equal over $108,000!!!! the cost of a brand new Corvette in 1982 was a tad over $20,000 so could have bought 2 of them for the price of this one. The inside leather is in terrific shape with no visible wear or tear thanks to the 1980's sheepskin seat covers that I am told have always been on the car protecting the seats. It comes with the hard top and the soft top. This car and its previous owners have made sure to document the milage as accurate and true as opposed to most letting it show exempt due to being over ten years old. So you can be sure of exactly what you are getting. the car runs great, A/C blows cold all the windows work and have not found anything not working. We would love to keep the car as an investment for ourselves but simply have no where to keep it inside and its a shame to leave a car that is this nice of this age outside for long. Come see it and although we are not giving this car away and feel the price is very very good on it we are open to cash reasonable cash offers.

title: 1973 Mercedes-Benz 450-Class

description: Gateway Classic Cars of Philadelphia welcomes this classy 1978 Mercedes-Benz 450SEL to its showroom located in West Deptford, NJ!  The Sonderklasse or W116 Special Class first appeared on the automotive scene in 1972 and went on to represent a high standard for technologically advanced luxury vehicles. Modest, yet bold in its styling the Mercedes S-Class earned worldwide recognition in its appearance and continues to do so in the car community today. This dapper 1978 450SEL wears sharp coat of light blue metallic paint that pairs beautifully with the dark blue interior.  Take a seat inside and admire the handsome woodgrain panels that flow into a chique console that holds the AM/FM Radio with cassette, climate controls as well as the shifter that is linked to the automatic transmission.  Turn the key and watch the gauges come to life as the original 4.5 L M117 V8 engine purrs.  Equipped with power windows as well as a power sunroof, you should have no problem letting some fresh air in the cabin while you coast down the highway. Relax and wrap your hands around the steering wheel and know that you and your passengers will be comfortable and stylish in the original leather seats.  Style and luxury are not the only things that this Mercedes boasts as the W116 S-Class featured a number of safety innovations including a strengthened body structure, wrap around turn signals and a padded dash to reduce injury during impacts.  Additionally, one will note the factory bumpers with rubber mounts as per highway safety regulation from the mid to late 1970s.  This 450SEL has it all; luxury, technology and safety, seamlessly brought together by the legendary German manufacturer. Look no further for a beautiful classic import for this Mercedes-Benz is ready to roll! Additional features include Power Steering, Power Brakes and factory wheels. To view this 1978 Mercedes-Benz 450SEL in greater detail, including HD pictures and an HD video, visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or our Philadelphia showroom located in West Deptford, NJ. For more information, please call 856-599-4100 or email Philadelphia@GatewayClassicCars.com

title: 1986 Mercedes-Benz 560-Class 560 SL

description: Not many cars can defy time like this beautiful and unusual 1980 Mercedes-Benz 450SL. Even today, nearly 30 years after they went out of production, they still command respect from the general masses, and remain grade-A cars to own and drive, representing huge bang for the buck.

Like most luxury models, you could pretty much get whatever color you wanted on your SL, even in 1980. While so many of these cars were red, white, or beige, this 450SL sports a lovely silver paint job that works splendidly with the unusual tan interior. It also represents the high-water mark for the R107 roadster, a near-ideal blend of style and luxury that made it the premier luxury car of the era. It was repainted at some point, but the finish remains in good condition given the car's age, a testament to the care this car has received over the past two-and-a-half decades. Gaps and panel fit are to typical German standards and remain excellent today, indicating that this car has never been hit or wrecked. Light colors tend to minimize flaws, but even on close inspection this one has laser-straight flanks, crisply rendered body lines, and almost zero signs of road rash in any of the usual locations. All the chrome and stainless remains bright, and the US-spec rubber bumpers, which usually suffer from degradation in the sunlight, remain supple and clear. It's obvious someone loved this car for many years.

The all original tan interior is a sophisticated and unusual compliment to the silver paint, with seats beautifully rendered in MB-Tex that is both comfortable and durable. The interior's condition strongly suggests that it has been exceptionally well maintained since new: there are no wear issues on the seats, the carpets are appropriate to the car's age and mileage, and the rear package shelf, which always gets baked in the sun, shows zero discoloration, which is surely helped by the light color. You'll also note that lots of features were standard on an SL, ranging from air conditioning to cruise control to power windows, and the original Becker radio has been replaced by an AM/FM/CD head unit powering extra speakers behind the seats. Overhead there's an easy to use convertible top that fits snugly, and all SLs came standard with matching hardtops. The trunk has its original carpets that are as plush as those you'll find in lesser cars' passenger compartments, as well as a full-sized spare tire stashed underneath.

The 4.5 liter V8 is a wonderful machine, torquey and smooth with a fantastic bubbly exhaust note that sings in appropriately hushed tones thanks to a correct exhaust system. Known for their longevity, these engines are virtually indestructible given proper maintenance, and will happily run for hundreds of thousands of miles with just gas and oil changes. Judging by the underhood area, this one has been maintained over the years and shows signs of recent service, including some ignition components, hoses, and filters. A 3-spee

The vehicle is finished in a unique and RARE Caledonian Green color scheme that sets itself apart from your average SL, while maintaining a classic vintage feel. The vehicle maintains its original Becker radio, original hardtop, books, and more giving you an entrance into classic convertibles without breaking the bank. The vehicle features a NEW TOP and has undergone recent service at European specialists, Precision Imports, and is ready to be driven and enjoyed this summer. description: This very collectable 1972 Mercedes-Benz 350SL R107 Roadster with only 78,063 original/documented miles was the first year of the US model 107 series.  Off White (717) with Black (040) hardtop, new black German canvas soft top, and immaculate Black (161) MB Tex interior.  This vehicle has been a single family owned vehicle since the early 1980s and comes with all original books and records.  The former owner left the vehicle to his son and daughter with all documentation.  Loaded with features including:  4.5L V8 engine, steel block and small European-style bumpers, 3-speed automatic transmission, new battery, cold air conditioning, original Becker German Europa audio system, original tool kit, power steering, power brakes, power antenna, steel wheels with classic hubcaps on recent 305/70R14 thin white wall tires, and much more. In addition it has had a fresh service in our own shop.  All mechanicals are factory original and in great working order.  the paint work and chrome is in excellent condition with all panels and doors fitting perfectly.  This is one of the nicest we have owned in 30 years.  This extremely cl ean and original classic convertible is perfect to drive or show.  The R107 model came on the scene in 1972 as a replace to the W113 series and had minimal changes until 1989 as a testament to its popularity.  It consisted of the debut of the V8 engine on the convertible weight.  Interestingly they were dubbed originally as 350SL despite having a 4.5L V8 engine to keep with the model designation for Europe.  A true classic vehicle.  View more pictures and information at www.europeanmotorcars-ltd.com
title: 1972 Mercedes-Benz SL-Class
